intro: Racosperma dallachianum, commonly known as the Dallachian wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow floral spikes. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It plays a role in nitrogen fixation, contributing to soil fertility in its native habitat. Its ornamental value has also led to its cultivation in gardens and landscapes.
